content.html:
Merged Grid GUI demo

‌

update.description:
By adding `<grid>` and `<plugin filename="GridConfig" ...>` to a file, grid GUI is loaded as plugin into ignition. An example sdf file is given below `grid.sdf`. The GUI allows user to modify cell count, cell length, pose and color. Currently, the GUI only works from sdf plugin, and not from the dropdown menu, due to possible conflict of default rendering engine `ogre` and dropdown menu engine `ogre2`

A relevant qml template used in the GUI is also added to `ign-gui` in this PR [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/239](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/239). It needs to be merged before this PR to prevent breaking.

A screen shot of the GUI

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1163921760-grid-gui.gif)
‌
update.title: Add GUI to configure grid

content.raw:
I’m ok with merging this PR for a couple of reasons. The crashes didn’t happen as often \(less than half the time\) when I was debugging. Most of them don’t interfere with the GUI functionality and only returns seg fault/mutex error upon shutdown. This GUI is a valuable feature to configure the grid. So yeah, monitoring crashes after merging this PR sounds good to me.

‌
content.html:
I’m ok with merging this PR for a couple of reasons. The crashes didn’t happen as often (less than half the time) when I was debugging. Most of them don’t interfere with the GUI functionality and only returns seg fault/mutex error upon shutdown. This GUI is a valuable feature to configure the grid. So yeah, monitoring crashes after merging this PR sounds good to me.

‌

content.raw:
Thank you @jshep1 and @{5d3f35705e485d0dab01c896} for documenting all the crashes. I've been playing with this for 1 hour and:

* Got no runtime crashes
* Got 4 different types of crashes during shutdown. Most times the program shuts down cleanly though.
* Shutdown crashes seem to happen more often when shutting down the GUI with `Ctrl+C` inside GDB.
* Out of my 4 crashes, I can reproduce at least 2 of them on the `ign-gazebo2` branch, so they're not related by this PR.
* One of the crashes is the boost thread one listed above. I could only reproduce it a single time, so it's tough to debug.
* The other 3 crashes are documented [here](https://gist.github.com/chapulina/ea514bb682172c27dfcec70e7c563ce9).
* I wasn't able to get any crashes pointing at the `this->moveToThread` line

Given all that, I'm inclined to get this in so we can unblock other PRs. We should keep an eye on these crashes though. What do the 2 of you think?
content.html:
Thank you @jshep1 and @Claire Wang for documenting all the crashes. I've been playing with this for 1 hour and:

  • Got no runtime crashes
  • Got 4 different types of crashes during shutdown. Most times the program shuts down cleanly though.
  • Shutdown crashes seem to happen more often when shutting down the GUI with Ctrl+C inside GDB.
  • Out of my 4 crashes, I can reproduce at least 2 of them on the ign-gazebo2 branch, so they're not related by this PR.
  • One of the crashes is the boost thread one listed above. I could only reproduce it a single time, so it's tough to debug.
  • The other 3 crashes are documented here.
  • I wasn't able to get any crashes pointing at the this->moveToThread line

Given all that, I'm inclined to get this in so we can unblock other PRs. We should keep an eye on these crashes though. What do the 2 of you think?

content.raw:

content.raw:
Some notes about the UI:

* I'd remove the `/` from the units, i.e. `Position (m)`
* Put the field name in front of the spin box, not on top of it (that's more common)
content.html:
Some notes about the UI:

  • I'd remove the / from the units, i.e. Position (m)
  • Put the field name in front of the spin box, not on top of it (that's more common)

update.description:
By adding `<grid>` and `<plugin filename="GridConfig" ...>` to a file, grid GUI is loaded as plugin into ignition. An example sdf file is given below `grid.sdf`. The GUI allows user to modify cell count, cell length, pose and color. Currently, the GUI only works from sdf plugin, and not from the dropdown menu, due to possible conflict of default rendering engine `ogre` and dropdown menu engine `ogre2`

A relevant qml template used in the GUI is also added to `ign-gui` in this PR [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/239](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/239). It needs to be merged before this PR to prevent breaking.

A screen shot of the GUI

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1163921760-grid-gui.gif)
‌
update.title: Add GUI to configure grid

content.html:
Aside from the above two crashes related to renderthread shutdown , I also got another seg fault while updating gridptr related features. This seg fault shuts down the grid simulation window and interferes with the grid update process.

Thread 18 "ignition::gazeb" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
[Switching to Thread 0x7fff97597700 (LWP 8513)]
0x00007ffff170fdf0 in QObject::thread() const ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5

/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5(0x7ffff170fdf0) [0x7ffff170fdf0]
/home/claire/blueprint_ws/install/lib/ign-gazebo-2/plugins/gui/libGzScene3D.so(_ZN8ignition6gazebo2v212RenderThread8ShutDownEv+0x55) [0x7fffac59f455]
/home/claire/blueprint_ws/src/ign-gazebo/src/gui/plugins/scene3d/Scene3D.cc:1253
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5(_ZN7QObject5eventEP6QEvent+0xe2) [0x7ffff17130c2]

Related code block

/////////////////////////////////////////////////
void RenderThread::ShutDown()
{
  this->context->makeCurrent(this->surface);

  this->ignRenderer.Destroy();

  this->context->doneCurrent();
  delete this->context;

  // schedule this to be deleted only after we're done cleaning up
  this->surface->deleteLater();

  // Stop event processing, move the thread to GUI and make sure it is deleted.
  this->moveToThread(QGuiApplication::instance()->thread()); // seg fault backtrace line
}

‌

content.raw:
I was able to reproduce the same `mutex` error by making multiple rapid changes to `cell`related properties like `count`and `length` . I also observed two consecutive threads being created and exiting with no updates made to the grid. One thing worth noting is that this `mutex` fail only shows up upon closing the window and does not interfere with grid update process. 

```
ruby: /usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/recursive_mutex.hpp:113: void boost::recursive_mutex::lock(): Assertion `!pthread_mutex_lock(&m)' failed.

Thread 18 "ignition::gazeb" received signal SIGABRT, Aborted.
[Switching to Thread 0x7fff87fff700 (LWP 18225)]
__GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:51
51    ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c: No such file or directory.
```

‌
content.html:
I was able to reproduce the same mutex error by making multiple rapid changes to cellrelated properties like countand length . I also observed two consecutive threads being created and exiting with no updates made to the grid. One thing worth noting is that this mutex fail only shows up upon closing the window and does not interfere with grid update process. 

ruby: /usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/recursive_mutex.hpp:113: void boost::recursive_mutex::lock(): Assertion `!pthread_mutex_lock(&m)' failed.

Thread 18 "ignition::gazeb" received signal SIGABRT, Aborted.

The GUI allows user to modify cell count, cell length, pose and color. Currently, the GUI only works from sdf plugin, and not from the dropdown menu, due to possible conflict of default rendering engine `ogre` and dropdown menu engine `ogre2`

A relevant qml template used in the GUI is also added to `ign-gui` in this PR [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/239](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/239). It needs to be merged before this PR to prevent breaking.

content.raw: as per our offline discussion, the min height displays everything in the plugin, user just needs to use the scroll bar or manually enlarge the window to see all the loaded plugins.
content.html: as per our offline discussion, the min height displays everything in the plugin, user just needs to use the scroll bar or manually enlarge the window to see all the loaded plugins.

content.raw: Thanks for looking into it! I withdrew my approval for now until we gather more info on the crashes.
content.html: Thanks for looking into it! I withdrew my approval for now until we gather more info on the crashes.

content.raw:
I think that error is introduced by this branch, that being said, ignition already seg faults on shutdown half of the time anyway so…:sweat_smile: I also noticed something that might be related when running in gdb:

```
[New Thread 0x7fff71ffe700 (LWP 31651)]
[New Thread 0x7fff717fd700 (LWP 31652)]
[Thread 0x7fff717fd700 (LWP 31652) exited]
[Thread 0x7fff71ffe700 (LWP 31651) exited]
```

When the GridConfig plugin is loaded in, threads are created and two of them exit quickly after being created. This might warrant some extra observation.
content.html:
I think that error is introduced by this branch, that being said, ignition already seg faults on shutdown half of the time anyway so… I also noticed something that might be related when running in gdb:

[New Thread 0x7fff71ffe700 (LWP 31651)]
[New Thread 0x7fff717fd700 (LWP 31652)]
[Thread 0x7fff717fd700 (LWP 31652) exited]
[Thread 0x7fff71ffe700 (LWP 31651) exited]

When the GridConfig plugin is loaded in, threads are created and two of them exit quickly after being created. This might warrant some extra observation.

content.raw: Works well for me!  I left a few comments.  One thing that we could also think about is preferencing degrees over radians for the RPY inputs, we went this direction for the snap RPY values as they are more user intuitive so I think it might be better to stay consistent across plugins, but I could see the use case for both rads and degrees.
content.html: Works well for me! I left a few comments. One thing that we could also think about is preferencing degrees over radians for the RPY inputs, we went this direction for the snap RPY values as they are more user intuitive so I think it might be better to stay consistent across plugins, but I could see the use case for both rads and degrees.

content.html: I think all the spin boxes might need an intuitive maximumValue The current max seems to be 99 for all of them → x, y, z, cell length, horizontal and vertical cell count. Maybe x, y, and z can go up to +1000 since their minimums are -1000.

update.description:
By adding `<grid>` and `<plugin filename="GridConfig" ...>` to a file, grid GUI is loaded as plugin into ignition. An example sdf file is given below `grid.sdf`. The GUI allows user to modify cell count, cell length, pose and color. Currently, the GUI only works from sdf plugin, and not from the dropdown menu, due to possible conflict of default rendering engine `ogre` and dropdown menu engine `ogre2`

A relevant qml template used in the GUI is also added to `ign-gui` in this PR [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/239](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/239). It needs to be merged before this PR to prevent breaking.

A screen shot of the GUI

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1163921760-grid-gui.gif)
‌
update.title: Add GUI to configure grid

content.raw:
Thanks for testing! I'm trying to reproduce those.

>  I observed a slightly longer (~2s) "black window“ time in the start up when scene is getting generated

What world were you loading? And is the entire window black, or just the 3D scene?

> I experienced one crash which trace back to

Do you remember how you got there? I'm not being able to reproduce.

> one mutex related error message after closing the GUI window.

I feel like I've seen this before. Next time it happens, can you try checking which line in our code gets to that? It could be one of the new mutexes, but it could also be an old one.
content.html:
Thanks for testing! I'm trying to reproduce those.

I observed a slightly longer (~2s) "black window“ time in the start up when scene is getting generated

What world were you loading? And is the entire window black, or just the 3D scene?

I experienced one crash which trace back to

Do you remember how you got there? I'm not being able to reproduce.

one mutex related error message after closing the GUI window.

I feel like I've seen this before. Next time it happens, can you try checking which line in our code gets to that? It could be one of the new mutexes, but it could also be an old one.

I’m testing the committed changes. I observed a slightly longer (~2s) "black window“ time in the start up when scene is getting generated. I experienced one crash which trace back to

/home/claire/blueprint_ws/install/lib/ign-gazebo-2/plugins/gui/libGzScene3D.so(_ZN8ignition6gazebo2v212RenderThread8ShutDownEv+0x2e) 
[0x7f46dccaa6be] /home/claire/blueprint_ws/src/ign-gazebo/src/gui/plugins/scene3d/Scene3D.cc:1005

void RenderThread::ShutDown()
{
  this->context->makeCurrent(this->surface);

  this->ignRenderer.Destroy();

  this->context->doneCurrent(); // Scene3D.cc: 1005, error traceback line
  delete this->context;

  // schedule this to be deleted only after we're done cleaning up
  this->surface->deleteLater();

  // Stop event processing, move the thread to GUI and make sure it is deleted.
  this->moveToThread(QGuiApplication::instance()->thread());
}

and one mutex related error message after closing the GUI window.

ruby: /usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/recursive_mutex.hpp:113: 
void boost::recursive_mutex::lock(): Assertion `!pthread_mutex_lock(&m)' failed.

The above errors are happening no matter if grid is enabled and disabled in sdf file.

However, if the grid is not set in the sdf file (no <grid>). Grid is enabled by default. Another error pops up and seems to be related to threading.

/home/claire/blueprint_ws/install/lib/ign-gazebo-2/plugins/gui/libGzScene3D.so(_ZN8ignition6gazebo2v212RenderThread8ShutDownEv+0x55) 
[0x7fee214ab6e5] /home/claire/blueprint_ws/src/ign-gazebo/src/gui/plugins/scene3d/Scene3D.cc:1012

void RenderThread::ShutDown()
{
  this->context->makeCurrent(this->surface);

  this->ignRenderer.Destroy();

  this->context->doneCurrent();
  delete this->context;

  // schedule this to be deleted only after we're done cleaning up
  this->surface->deleteLater();

  // Stop event processing, move the thread to GUI and make sure it is deleted.
  this->moveToThread(QGuiApplication::instance()->thread()); // Scene3D.cc: 1012, error traceback line 
}

‌

@Claire Wang , take a look at 96e41c1 and let me know what you think. That commit introduces a Render event, which is emitted by IgnRenderer, and runs in the RenderThread. I moved all Ignition Rendering calls to that callback and now I get no more crashes. That also removes the need for a timer, because the render event is already called periodically, and in fact, we know that if we're getting an event it means that the 3D scene has already been created.

Note that GuiEvents.hh is also being added on pull request #515 and pull request #493, so there will be some conflicts depending on which gets merged first.

CC @Ian Chen

update.description:
By adding `<grid>` and `<plugin filename="GridConfig" ...>` to a file, grid GUI is loaded as plugin into ignition. An example sdf file is given below `grid.sdf`. The GUI allows user to modify cell count, cell length, pose and color. Currently, the GUI only works from sdf plugin, and not from the dropdown menu, due to possible conflict of default rendering engine `ogre` and dropdown menu engine `ogre2`

A relevant qml template used in the GUI is also added to `ign-gui` in this PR [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/239](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/239). It needs to be merged before this PR to prevent breaking.

content.raw:
@{5d3f35705e485d0dab01c896} , I pushed a few tweaks in  0dac116:

* `ShowGrid` -> `CreateGrid`
* Also check `if (!scene->IsInitialized() || scene->VisualCount() == 0)` before stopping timer
* Allow negative numbers on the pose.

I'm still looking into the create grid threading issue.
content.html:
@Claire Wang , I pushed a few tweaks in 0dac116:

  • ShowGrid -> CreateGrid
  • Also check if (!scene->IsInitialized() || scene->VisualCount() == 0) before stopping timer
  • Allow negative numbers on the pose.

I'm still looking into the create grid threading issue.
